intro: Chesneya tadzhikistana, commonly known as the Tajikistan chesneya, is a rare and unique plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, fragrant aroma. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
